title: How to Make Vegan Fudge

text: Making Chocolate Vegan Fudge Grease the pan with any type of vegan oil or margarine. Place a medium-sized pot on your stove. Turn the stove on a medium-high setting. Pour the margarine and milk into the pot. Slowly bring it to a simmer. Stir constantly until there are no lumps. At this step, the fudge should start to thicken. If it's too thin (like a runny batter), then keep stirring and simmering! Add the rest of the ingredients and stir. Once it reaches a low boil, make sure the mixture is smooth, and then take the pot off the stove and place on a hot pad. Pour the contents of the pot into the pan and place into the fridge. Let the fudge chill overnight or until firm. Cut into squares. Place the fudge on a plate or platter for a nice touch. Homemade fudge is also a nice gift to give. Enjoy! Making Peanut Butter Vegan Fudge Place your pot on your stove. Melt the margarine in it over low heat. Add the peanut butter and milk. Slowly stir until the fudge is smooth. Make sure that there are no lumps (besides peanuts if you are using chunky peanut butter) before moving onto the next step. Add the rest of the ingredients slowly and stir. Make sure the fudge is smooth. Once it has reached a boil, remove the pot from the stove. Pour into a greased pan. Make sure that the fudge is not too runny. If the fudge is too runny, allow it to simmer for a few more minutes. Allow it to chill in the refrigerator for two to three hours or until firm. You can check to see if your fudge is firm by placing a toothpick down the middle and seeing if it penetrates easily or with a little resistance. Cut into squares and enjoy! You can store this fudge in an airtight container. This fudge stays fresh for about 5-7 days. To help keep it fresh, store it in a cool fridge. Making Coconut Vegan Fudge Grease the pan with vegan margarine. You can also grease the pan with vegetable oil. Place the coconut flakes in a blender. Blend the flakes until they are crumbly. Check to make sure that there are no chunks of coconut flakes. Pour the coconut flakes and the coconut milk into the pot and stir on low. Once smooth, add the vanilla and salt, and stir. Do not worry if the fudge looks lighter because vanilla usually changes the colour and causes it to foam up. Let the fudge reach a boil. Add the remaining ingredients. Stir until the fudge is smooth and has no lumps. Allow the fudge to simmer for about five minutes. Place the pot on a hot pad. Pour the fudge into the greased pan. Level the top of the fudge with a spatula, to make sure that when the fudge hardens, it is even. Place the fudge in a fridge. Let the fudge chill for three hours or until firm. Cut into squares and place on a plate. This fudge is perfect for parties and is a great homemade gift. Enjoy your fudge!
